abstract: Analysis by New York City's Center for Economic Opportunity shows the number of city residents classified as poor in 2010 increased by nearly 100,000 from 2009, raising the poverty rate by 1.3 percentage points to 21 percent; figures show highest level and largest year-to-year increase since city adopted a more detailed definition of poverty in 2005.
